Statements: under extreme stress, tumor cells with apoptosis-defective genetic backgrounds die via other mechanisms (kondo and kondo, 2006; gozuacik and kimchi, 2007). sustained autophagic activation, which leads to turnover of proteins and organelles beyond a survival threshold, can kill some cancer cells with high apoptotic thresholds, thus enhancing treatment efficacy (yang et al., 2011). in this case, therefore, cell death via autophagy could provide an alternative therapeutic strategy (gozuacik and kimchi, 2007; eisenberg-lerner et al., 2009).
